required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Outcomes After Weight Loss Surgery in Low-Risk Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Patient Reported Outcomes After Weight Loss Surgery in Low-Risk Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research is to determine patient-reported outcomes after weight loss surgery, including changes in health, mood, quality of life, health satisfaction, and emotional health, in low-risk patients. Weight loss surgery has been well studied for patients with body mass index (BMI) 35 kg/m^2 or more and those with weight-related medical problems who have a BMI 30 kg/m^2 or more. However, outcomes after weight loss surgery in patients with BMI under 35 kg/m^2 and without co-morbidities have not been well studied.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this research is to determine patient-reported outcomes after weight loss surgery in low-risk patients. Weight loss surgery has been well-studied for patients with body mass index (BMI) 35 kg/m^2 or more and those with weight-related medical problems who have a BMI 30 kg/m^2 or more. Weight-related medical problems, also called co-morbidities, can include diabetes mellitus, hypertension, sleep apnea, and degenerative joint diseases. The surgery is considered safe and effective. Outcomes after weight loss surgery in patients with BMI under 35 kg/m^2 and without co-morbidities have not been well studied. The investigators' purpose is to study patient-reported outcomes after weight loss surgery in patients with BMI between 30 kg/m^2 and 34.5 kg/m^2 without co-morbidities. These include changes in health, mood, quality of life, health satisfaction, and emotional health.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Perception of General Health
primary_outcome.description: A survey will be administered to determine changes in one's self-assessed general health.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Perception of Body Image
primary_outcome.description: Surveys will be administered to determine changes in one's self-assessed body image.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Perception of Quality of Life
primary_outcome.description: Surveys will be administered to determine changes in one's self-assessed quality of life.

arm_group.description: Patients with BMI between 30-34.5 kg/m2 will be administered a body image/self-esteem questionnaire pre-operatively and at 1 month, 3 months, 6 months and 12 months post-operatively.

intervention.description: Pre-operation and post-operation questionnaires to assess factors including but not limited to body image, quality of life, and self-esteem.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with BMI between 30 kg/m2 and 34.5 kg/m2 without co-morbidities who are medically cleared to undergo cosmetic weight loss surgery.
- Written informed consent obtained from the subject or the subject's legal representative and the ability for the subject to comply with the requirements of the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are pregnant.
- Patients with BMI below 30 kg/m2.
- Patients with BMI above 34.5 kg/m2.
- Patients who have co-morbidities including, but not limited to, diabetes mellitus, hypertension, sleep apnea, and degenerative joint disease.
- Patients who are not medically cleared to undergo weight loss surgery.
